page.title: 15CLIFFS _ NORTH NORFOLK
page.content: The cliffs in the Mundesley-Triming- ham area exhibit what is perhaps the finest series of Pliocene-Pleistocene deposits in the country. The bed rock of the upper chalk ( ostrea Lunata ) shows at Trimingham with overlaying deposits of Marine Crag and Cromer Forest Beds; remains of mammoths,sabre-toothed tigers etc are sometimes found. Glacial deposits above these layers range from Cromer Till to Little Eastern Gravels. These deposits have been piled up to form the Cromer Holt Ridge,comprising the highest land in the county. Our cliffs are where this Ridge reaches the sea. The loose, crumbling deposits which form the cliffs contain water in tiny rivulets which weakens the material which can reslt in cliff falls. The stormy winter seas remove this scree.
